intro: Celsia arbuscula, commonly known as the dwarf celsia, is a small, flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes many species of shrubs and herbs. The plant features compact, evergreen foliage with small, dark green leaves that are arranged in opposite pairs. It produces clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom throughout the year. Celsia arbuscula is often cultivated as a decorative plant due to its attractive appearance and ease of care.
